intro: Skutchia caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed skutchia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive elongated style. Skutchia caudata is adapted to arid conditions, showcasing features that help it conserve water and withstand drought.
